means: 限量供应，配给供应(ration的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: Rationing had put an end to a surfeit of biscuits long ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 定量供应很久以前就结束了饼干过剩的状况。

sentence.Network_en: As a hangover from rationing, they mixed butter and margarine.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为食品配给制的一种遗留影响，他们总把黄油和人造黄油混在一起吃。

sentence.Network_en: They righteously maintain that they do not practise rationing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们一本正经地坚称不实行定量配给制度。

entry.def: Rationing is the system of limiting the amount of food, water, petrol, or other necessary substances that each person is allowed to have or buy when there is not enough of them.

example.ex: The municipal authorities here are preparing for food rationing.
example.tran: 这里的市政当局正准备实施食物配给制度。

sentences.sentence: "during the war the government imposed rationing of food and gasoline"

auth_sentence.content: In effect, he will be rationing the care.
auth_sentence.res_content: In effect, he will be rationing the care.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In effect, he will be rationing the care.

auth_sentence.content: When rationing ends and beef begins flooding the market.
auth_sentence.res_content: When rationing ends and beef begins flooding the market.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When rationing ends and beef begins flooding the market.

auth_sentence.content: They got rid of all the remaining rationing everywhere.
auth_sentence.res_content: They got rid of all the remaining rationing everywhere.

Sentence.sentence: As rationing came to an end in the 1950s, technology picked up and was used to mass-produce food," Tomes says.

sentences.en: Food rationing was abolished in that country long ago.
sentences.cn: 那个国家早就取消了粮食配给制。

sentences.en: Strict rationing of basic foodstuffs was still in force by the end of the year.
sentences.cn: 到年底还在实施严格的基本粮食配给。
